title.value: Utilizing of distillery spent grains for the production of biobutanol
Использование послеспиртовой зерновой барды для получения биобутанола

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Kolomiets, Eh.I., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Microbiology

abstract.value: Dried distillers spent grains appears a large waste of ethanol production, representing instable suspension of the vestiges of crushed grain in water solution medium and spirit yeasts and consisting of solid and liquid phases. Solid substance appears a valuable protein feed, used for cattle feeding. Liquid phase of dried distillers spent grains represents water solution of organic substances, amino acids, sugars and organic acids and appears a waste substance, causing environmental contamination. Therefore, use of dried distillers spent grains as a substrate for biogas production reveals a new way of wastes utilization. The main goal of the research is evaluation of the ability of the use of dried distillers spent grains as a substrate for bio-butanol receiving by anaerobic fermentation with the help of Clostridium bacteria. The formulated composition of the nutrient medium based on rye flour and stillage centrifuge centrate enables to reduce the costs of conventional acetone-butanol-ethanol fermentation and entails no loss of process productivity.
